Module atu.aicme4j
Package jhealy.aicme4j.net

Enum Class Loss

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<Loss>
jhealy.aicme4j.net.Loss
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<Loss>, Constable
public enum Loss extends Enum<Loss>
Enum for neural network loss functions. A loss function compares the expected values from a training set with the predicted values that are output by a neural network. A loss function is a measure of how well a neural network models its training data.

Aicme4j uses the loss function during backpropagation training to compute the error of the predicted values in the output layer of the neural network. The loss function are comprised of a residual and an accumulator. A residual is the difference between the value expected from the row of features in the training data and the value predicted by the neural network. An accumulator computes the overall error in an output layer for a training epoch. When the training error falls below a specified minimum error the training algorithm will stop.

Since:
Aicme4j 1.0
Author:
Dr. John Healy, ATU.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Enum

  • Enum Constant Summary

    Enum Constants
    Enum Constant
    Description
    CEE
    Cross Entropy Loss Error computes the loss as the negative sum of the product of the log of the predicted value and the expected value.
    MAE
    The Mean Absolute Error (L1 Loss) computes the mean of absolute difference between the residuals in the output layer of the network.
    MSE
    The Mean Squared Error (L2 Loss) computes the mean of the square of the difference of the residuals in the output layer of the network.
    SSE
    The Sum of Squared Errors computes the sum of the squares of the residuals in the output layer of the network.

  • Enum Constant Details

    • CEE

      public static final Loss CEE
      Cross Entropy Loss Error computes the loss as the negative sum of the product of the log of the predicted value and the expected value. The softmax function is applied to output layer values and the natural log of each softmaxed value is multiplied by its expected value. As all values will be <0, the nearer the value is to 1 (a correct prediction) the lower of log error.

    • SSE

      public static final Loss SSE
      The Sum of Squared Errors computes the sum of the squares of the residuals in the output layer of the network.

    • MAE

      public static final Loss MAE
      The Mean Absolute Error (L1 Loss) computes the mean of absolute difference between the residuals in the output layer of the network.

    • MSE

      public static final Loss MSE
      The Mean Squared Error (L2 Loss) computes the mean of the square of the difference of the residuals in the output layer of the network.

    • error

      public double error(double[] errors, double[] expected)
      Returns the overall error for a training epoch. When the training error falls below a specified minimum error the training algorithm will stop.
      Parameters:
      errors - the error for each node in the output layer
      expected - the expected values for each node in the output layer
      Returns:
      the error at the end of the current epoch.
